poem:
**Voices in the Blue Building**

In the shadow  
of the blue, unyielding tower,  
women weave their strength  
from words whispered  
behind closed doors.   
Idlib's dust cannot silence  
hope or hold captive the thread  
of their dreams.  
Invisible, they stitch  
a new fabric, unseen yet felt,  
binding the future  
to their patient, persistent hands.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘We’ve proved we can do anything’: the Syrian women who want a say in running the country The feminist activist Ghalia Rahhal recalls with wry laughter her visit to the “blue building” in Idlib three years ago, an office where the group Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS) monitored civil society organisations such as hers. Her colleague at a women’s rights organisation was once called there to hear a list of issues they were banned from working". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
